definition: leading (role)/heading list of signatories/leading actors (in a show)/starring
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
bit (of a bridle)/to hold in the mouth/to harbor (feelings)/to link/to accept/rank/title

sentences.english: Liu Xiang spearheads Team China to Daegu meet.
sentences.chinese: 刘翔领衔中国队出征大邱世锦赛。

sentences.english: The Caoyu is the most important person in Chinese drama history.
sentences.chinese: 曹禺是中国戏剧史上的领衔人物。

sentences.english: The Chinese delegation will be headed by chairman of the National Reforms Development Commission (NDRC) Xu Shaoshi.
sentences.chinese: 中国代表团将由国家发展改革委主任徐绍史领衔。

sentences.english: Wayne Rooney will spearhead the attack and look to keep his incredible goalscoring run going.
sentences.chinese: 鲁尼领衔锋线，尝试继续他不可思议的进球势头。

sentences.english: Filmed in China, the picture stars Jaden Smith and Jackie Chan.
sentences.chinese: 该片是在中国拍摄的，由杰登史密斯和成龙领衔主演。

sentences.english: The headliners at the gig last night weren't as good as I expected.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚演唱会上的领衔乐队没我期望的那么好。

definition: to play a leading role/to bear a heavy responsibility
to take the lead in a race/to set the pace
(of a commanding officer) to keep watch/to oversee
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
Cenozoic (geological era covering the last 65m years)
hand in hand/to join hands/to collaborate
